title: Carl Frampton is excited to make his comeback against Tyler McCreary after suffering a freak injury
text:
Carl Frampton will look to draw a line under what has been 'a horrific year' when he takes on unbeaten American Tyler McCreary at The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas on November 30.

Frampton was set to take on Emmanuel Dominguez in August but the bout was scuppered in freakish circumstances when a large ornament fell on the Northern Irishman's left hand, leading to a fracture of his fifth metacarpal.

Carl Frampton is raring to go after returning to the ring and says he wants to be challenged

However, the Belfast fighter will be back in action next month in a 10-round contest that will be held at a catch-weight of 128lbs, two pounds below the super-featherweight limit.

'I'm delighted to be making a comeback after what has been a horrific year in my career,' Frampton said.

Double header. Viva Las Vegas pic.twitter.com/CRLRvhZJWC — Carl Frampton MBE (@RealCFrampton) October 15, 2019

'I didn't get the Top Rank deal off to an ideal start, but coming back in Vegas is great for me, especially against a really strong opponent. It needed to be someone who would test me.

'McCreary is a quality opponent, but if I want to be competing against the top guys in the world, which I believe I can, then I need to be beating guys like him and doing it in style.'
description: Frampton was set to take on Emmanuel Dominguez in August but the bout was scuppered in freakish circumstances when a large ornament fell on the Northern Irishman's left hand.
